summary: Build a standalone binary classification model (UP/DOWN) using NEW features specifically designed for DOWN detection, then ensemble it with the existing regression meta-model (attempt 7). The regression model has 96% bullish bias -- it almost always predicts UP. In 2026 YTD, it correctly predicted 21/31 days overall but caught only 1/10 down days. A classification XGBoost using the SAME 24 features failed completely (P(UP) always 0.46-0.51, zero discrimination). The problem is that the existing 24 features do not contain enough DOWN-specific information. We need features that capture momentum exhaustion, volatility regime shifts, cross-asset stress, and reversal signals.

regression_model_behavior.2026_ytd_performance: 21/31 correct overall, but only 1/10 DOWN days caught

why_same_features_failed_for_classificat: All 24 features are designed to predict gold RETURN magnitude, not direction change
Regime probability features (7 of 24) are slow-moving state indicators, not reversal signals
Z-score features capture mean-reversion tendency but not exhaustion timing
No features capture intra-day momentum collapse, volume climax, or cross-market contagion
XGBoost classifier with same features produced P(UP) in 0.46-0.51 range for ALL samples -- zero discrimination
what_down_days_look_like: Sudden reversals after extended rallies (momentum exhaustion)
VIX spike + DXY strength + equity selloff (risk-off cascade)
Gold-specific: GVZ spike without corresponding VIX move (gold-specific fear)
Volume anomalies: abnormally high volume on flat/negative days
Cross-asset divergence: gold diverges from silver/copper (relative value reset)
Fed surprise: hawkish communication causing rate spike + gold drop

requirements: Build a binary classification model (UP=1/DOWN=0) using 15-25 NEW features specifically designed for DOWN-day detection. The classifier should focus on capturing reversal signals, momentum exhaustion, volatility regime changes, and cross-asset stress patterns that are NOT present in the existing 24 regression features. Output: P(DOWN) probability for each day, to be ensembled with regression predictions via a threshold-based override system.

target_variable.definition: Binary: 1 if next-day gold return > 0 (UP), 0 otherwise (DOWN)
target_variable.note_on_flat_days: Days with exactly 0% return are extremely rare (<0.5%) and should be classified as DOWN (conservative) since the regression model already has UP bias
target_variable.class_balance: Approximately 58-60% UP / 40-42% DOWN in training data (moderate imbalance)
target_variable.why_binary_not_ternary: A UP/FLAT/DOWN tri-class model would reduce effective sample size per class too much with only ~2500 samples. Binary is more robust.

category_1_momentum_exhaustion.description: Features that detect when an uptrend is losing steam -- the most direct DOWN predictor

candidate_features.name: rsi_14d
candidate_features.formula: Standard RSI with 14-day lookback on gold close prices
candidate_features.rationale: RSI > 70 historically signals overbought conditions and reversal risk. Unlike existing tech_mean_reversion_z (which captures z-score of returns), RSI specifically captures momentum exhaustion timing.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Low -- tech_mean_reversion_z is z-score of GLD returns, not RSI-based

candidate_features.name: gold_streak_days
candidate_features.formula: Consecutive days with positive (or negative) returns
candidate_features.rationale: Extended winning streaks (5+ days) create mean-reversion pressure. No existing feature tracks sequential patterns.

candidate_features.name: momentum_divergence
candidate_features.formula: Sign(5-day return) != Sign(20-day return). Or: 5d_return - 20d_return normalized
candidate_features.rationale: When short-term momentum decouples from medium-term, reversals become likely. Captures trend fatigue.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Low -- no multi-timeframe momentum comparison exists

candidate_features.name: distance_from_20d_high
candidate_features.formula: (close - 20d_high) / 20d_range. Near 0 = at high, near -1 = at low
candidate_features.rationale: Gold at 20-day high has higher probability of reversal than gold at 20-day midpoint

category_2_volatility_regime_shifts.description: Features capturing sudden changes in volatility that often precede DOWN days

candidate_features.name: gvz_spike
candidate_features.formula: GVZ z-score (current GVZ / 60-day rolling mean - 1). High values = fear spike
candidate_features.rationale: Sudden GVZ spikes indicate options market pricing in gold-specific risk. Unlike existing options_risk_regime_prob (HMM regime), this captures the MAGNITUDE of the spike.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Moderate with options_risk_regime_prob -- but regime_prob is binary-ish state, this is continuous intensity

candidate_features.name: gvz_vix_ratio_change
candidate_features.rationale: When GVZ rises faster than VIX, it means gold-specific fear is rising beyond general market fear. This is a gold-specific DOWN signal.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Low -- VIX level and VIX regime exist but not the GVZ/VIX ratio dynamic

candidate_features.name: realized_vol_ratio
candidate_features.formula: 5-day realized vol / 20-day realized vol. >1 means short-term vol expanding
candidate_features.rationale: Short-term vol expansion relative to medium-term is a classic reversal precursor. No existing feature captures this vol-of-vol concept.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Low -- tech_volatility_regime is from HMM, not ratio-based

candidate_features.name: intraday_range_ratio
candidate_features.rationale: Abnormally wide daily ranges often precede reversals. Large range = high uncertainty = directional change likely.

category_3_cross_asset_stress.description: Features capturing when multiple markets signal risk-off simultaneously

candidate_features.name: risk_off_score
candidate_features.rationale: When VIX rises, DXY strengthens, equities fall, and yields drop simultaneously, it is a strong risk-off signal that pressures gold from the USD side. No existing feature captures this multi-asset synchronization.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Low -- individual components exist but not the composite synchronization

candidate_features.name: gold_silver_divergence
candidate_features.rationale: Gold outperforming silver over 5 days signals gold is being bought as a safe haven (UP persistence). Silver outperforming means industrial demand driving, less safe-haven premium (DOWN risk for gold).
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Low -- xasset_divergence exists but captures a different cross-asset relationship

candidate_features.name: equity_gold_beta_5d
candidate_features.formula: Rolling 5-day beta of gold returns vs SP500 returns
candidate_features.rationale: Normally gold has near-zero or negative beta to equities. When beta turns positive (gold moves WITH equities), the safe-haven premium has collapsed, increasing DOWN risk.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: None -- no rolling beta feature exists

category_4_volume_and_flow_anomalies.description: Features capturing unusual volume patterns that signal distribution/accumulation

candidate_features.name: gld_volume_z
candidate_features.formula: Z-score of GLD daily volume vs 20-day rolling mean
candidate_features.rationale: Abnormally high volume on flat or negative days signals institutional distribution. The existing etf_capital_intensity captures dollar volume z-score but not the volume-vs-return divergence.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Moderate with etf_capital_intensity -- but this is raw volume z-score, not dollar-weighted

candidate_features.name: volume_price_disagreement
candidate_features.formula: High volume + negative return = bearish divergence. sign(return) * z_score(volume). Negative = distribution
candidate_features.rationale: Classic technical analysis: price up on low volume (weak rally, DOWN risk) vs price down on high volume (strong selling, DOWN continuation).
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Moderate with etf_pv_divergence -- but this captures a different formulation of PV relationship

category_5_rate_and_currency_shock.description: Features capturing sudden rate moves that historically cause gold selloffs

candidate_features.name: rate_surprise
candidate_features.formula: abs(real_rate_change) > 2*std(real_rate_change over 20 days). Binary or continuous surprise magnitude.
candidate_features.rationale: Sharp unexpected rate moves (especially upward) cause immediate gold price pressure. The base feature real_rate_change exists but does not capture the SURPRISE magnitude.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Moderate with real_rate_change -- but this captures abnormality, not direction

candidate_features.name: dxy_acceleration
candidate_features.formula: Second derivative: today's dxy_change minus yesterday's dxy_change
candidate_features.rationale: USD acceleration (increasingly positive changes) signals strengthening downward pressure on gold. Unlike raw dxy_change, acceleration captures the rate-of-change of the headwind.
candidate_features.existing_feature_overlap: Low -- dxy_change is first derivative only

category_6_calendar_and_seasonality.description: Features capturing day-of-week and seasonal patterns in gold returns

candidate_features.name: day_of_week
candidate_features.rationale: Gold exhibits statistically significant day-of-week effects (Monday effect, Friday effect). This is zero-cost information that can improve classification.

candidate_features.name: month_of_year
candidate_features.rationale: Gold has seasonal patterns (weak in March/September historically). XGBoost can learn tree splits on these.

research_questions: What is the empirical distribution of gold DOWN days by magnitude? What percentage of DOWN days are -0.5% or worse vs small -0.1% moves? Should we focus the classifier on 'significant DOWN' (>0.3% decline) rather than any DOWN?

Which momentum exhaustion indicators have the strongest predictive power for gold reversals? Compare: (a) RSI > 70 reversal frequency, (b) Bollinger Band width percentile, (c) consecutive positive-day streaks vs next-day return, (d) distance from N-day high vs next-day return. Compute conditional DOWN probabilities for each.

Does the GVZ/VIX ratio have predictive power for gold DOWN days? Specifically: when GVZ rises faster than VIX (gold-specific fear rising), does gold tend to decline in the next 1-3 days? Use FRED GVZCLS and VIXCLS data from 2008 onwards.
What is the optimal lookback period for the realized_vol_ratio feature (5d/20d vs 5d/60d vs 10d/30d)? Which ratio configuration maximizes the information gain for next-day direction classification?
Is there a day-of-week effect in gold returns? Compute average returns and DOWN-day frequency by weekday from 2015-2025. Are any days statistically significant at p<0.05?

How effective is focal loss vs weighted cross-entropy for class-imbalanced gold direction classification? Literature review on Imbalance-XGBoost (Wang et al., 2019) applicability to financial time series with 60/40 class split.

What threshold should define 'high-confidence DOWN' for the ensemble override? If the classifier outputs P(DOWN), should we override the regression prediction only when P(DOWN) > 0.55? > 0.60? > 0.65? What is the precision-recall tradeoff at each threshold?

What is the optimal feature count for a binary classifier on ~2500 samples? Literature suggests 10-20 features for this sample size. Should we use all candidate features and let the model select, or pre-filter via mutual information?

Are there known interactions between VIX regime and gold DOWN probability? Specifically: is P(gold DOWN | VIX regime = high-vol) different from P(gold DOWN | VIX regime = low-vol)? This would inform whether to include VIX regime as a classifier feature.

For ensemble combination: what is the literature on combining regression predictions with classification overrides? Is threshold-based override (our approach) optimal, or should we use a weighted probability combination? Are there papers on regression+classification ensemble for financial prediction?

primary.model: XGBoost with binary:logistic or focal loss
primary.rationale: Same framework as regression model, well-understood. Focal loss handles the ~60/40 class imbalance by down-weighting easy-to-classify UP days and focusing on hard DOWN cases.
primary.hyperparameter_search: Optuna 100 trials. Key HPs: max_depth [2-5], scale_pos_weight [0.8-2.0], focal_gamma [0-5], n_estimators [100-500]

alternative_1.rationale: Faster training, native categorical support (day_of_week), built-in focal loss support via custom objective. May outperform XGBoost on this task.
alternative_1.note: Requires pip install lightgbm in Kaggle notebook

alternative_2.model: Two-stage: Stage 1 = threshold filter, Stage 2 = neural net on filtered samples
alternative_2.rationale: First filter out obvious UP days (e.g. strong momentum, low VIX), then apply neural net only to ambiguous cases where DOWN detection matters most.
alternative_2.note: More complex, only if simple models fail

not_recommended.model: Same XGBoost classifier on same 24 features
not_recommended.rationale: ALREADY FAILED. P(UP) in 0.46-0.51 range for all samples. Zero discrimination. The features, not the model, are the bottleneck.

ensemble_strategy.description: The classifier outputs P(DOWN) for each day. When P(DOWN) exceeds a tuned threshold, the regression model's direction prediction is overridden to DOWN. When P(DOWN) is below the threshold, the regression model's prediction is used as-is.
ensemble_strategy.pseudo_code: if P(DOWN) > threshold: final_direction = DOWN; elif regression_pred > 0: final_direction = UP; else: final_direction = DOWN
ensemble_strategy.threshold_tuning: Optimize threshold on validation set to maximize composite metric: Sharpe + 0.5*(DA - 0.5). Test thresholds from 0.40 to 0.65 in 0.01 increments.
ensemble_strategy.expected_behavior: In 2026, convert some of the 9 missed DOWN days from false-UP to correct-DOWN predictions, while sacrificing minimal UP accuracy. Net improvement: +2-5pp DA, +0.2-0.5 Sharpe.
ensemble_strategy.fallback_if_classifier_hurts: Set threshold to 1.0 (never override) and the system degrades gracefully to regression-only. No harm done.

alternative_ensemble.weighted_probability: final_sign = sign(regression_pred * (1-alpha) + (2*P(UP)-1) * alpha), where alpha is tuned on validation
alternative_ensemble.when_to_use: If threshold-based override is too aggressive (sacrificing too many UP days for DOWN gains)

classifier_standalone.down_day_recall: > 30% (catch at least 30% of DOWN days -- currently catching ~10%)
classifier_standalone.down_day_precision: > 45% (when we predict DOWN, be right at least 45% of the time)
classifier_standalone.f1_down_class: > 0.35 (harmonic mean of DOWN precision and recall)
classifier_standalone.note: These thresholds are deliberately modest. The classifier does not need to be great alone -- it needs to ADD value when ensembled.

ensemble_improvement.down_day_capture_improvement: From ~10% to >25% of DOWN days correctly predicted
ensemble_improvement.up_day_accuracy_preservation: > 85% of UP days still correctly predicted (regression-only is ~96%)
ensemble_improvement.net_benefit: DA improvement must exceed UP accuracy loss. If we catch 3 more DOWN days but miss 5 UP days, that is a net negative.

meta_metric.primary: Ensemble Sharpe ratio on test set > 2.0 AND ensemble DA > 60%
meta_metric.failure_mode: If ensemble DA < regression-only DA, abandon the classifier

constraints: 5-day data delay rule: all data sources (yfinance, FRED) provide same-day or T+1 data. All safe.
The classifier does NOT predict gold returns. It predicts UP/DOWN direction only.
Use only free data sources: yfinance, FRED (FRED_API_KEY), CBOE (publicly available indices)
Must be trainable on Kaggle with GPU in < 30 minutes
Time-series split only (70/15/15). No shuffle, no random split.
No future information leakage: all features must be computable at market close of day T to predict day T+1
Feature count: 15-25 features. More than 25 on ~2500 samples risks overfitting. Fewer than 15 may miss important signals.
The classifier must use DIFFERENT features from the regression model's 24 features. Reusing the same features is proven to fail.
However, some raw data overlap is acceptable: both models may use GC=F close price, but they must TRANSFORM it differently (e.g., regression uses HMM regime_prob, classifier uses RSI)
Must include dataset_sources: bigbigzabuton/gold-prediction-submodels in kernel-metadata.json (for accessing existing submodel outputs if needed as auxiliary features)
The classifier's P(DOWN) output must be saved as a CSV for ensemble use

backtest_classification_failure.what_happened: XGBoost binary:logistic with same 24 features, Optuna 100 trials, scale_pos_weight tuning. P(UP) output was always 0.46-0.51 for all samples. Zero discrimination ability.
backtest_classification_failure.root_cause: Features designed for regression (magnitude prediction) do not contain directional reversal information. Regime probabilities are too slow-moving, z-scores are symmetric around 0.
backtest_classification_failure.lesson: MUST use different features. Same input -> same information -> same inability to discriminate.

meta_model_attempts_8_12.what_happened: 5 consecutive attempts to improve regression meta-model all regressed from attempt 7
meta_model_attempts_8_12.lesson_for_classifier: Adding features to an existing model framework has diminishing returns. A fundamentally different model (classification) with fundamentally different features is more promising than iterating on regression.
anti_patterns: Do not use stacking/ensemble meta-learners (Ridge collapse in attempt 8)
Do not add features to the regression model -- 5 attempts proved this fails
Do not use binary regime indicators with sparse activation

success_hypothesis: A standalone binary classifier with 15-25 NEW features focused on momentum exhaustion, volatility regime shifts, cross-asset stress, and volume anomalies will achieve DOWN-day recall > 30% and ensemble DA > 61%. By detecting even 3-5 additional DOWN days that the regression model misses, the ensemble Sharpe will remain above 2.0 while DA improves by 1-3 percentage points. The key insight is that DOWN detection requires DIFFERENT information (reversal signals, exhaustion patterns, stress synchronization) than return magnitude prediction (regime states, mean-reversion, persistence).

classifier_output.format: CSV with columns: Date, p_up, p_down, predicted_direction
classifier_output.rows: Same date range as base_features (~2500 rows)

ensemble_output.format: CSV with columns: Date, regression_pred, classifier_p_down, ensemble_direction, ensemble_confidence

training_result.format: JSON with classifier metrics, ensemble metrics, feature importance, threshold optimization results

pipeline_notes.differs_from_submodel_pipeline: This is NOT a submodel in the traditional sense. It does not feed features into the regression meta-model. It is a parallel model whose output is combined with the regression model at the prediction stage.
pipeline_notes.no_gate_2_evaluation: Gate 2 (MI/VIF/stability) does not apply -- the classifier is not feeding features into XGBoost.
pipeline_notes.modified_gate_3: Instead of ablation vs baseline, evaluate: ensemble vs regression-only on DA, Sharpe, and DOWN capture.
pipeline_notes.data_flow: Raw data -> NEW features -> Binary classifier -> P(DOWN) -> Ensemble with regression pred -> Final direction

meta_model_context.bullish_bias: 87.3% positive predictions in test set. 96% positive in 2026 YTD
meta_model_context.2026_ytd: 21/31 correct, 1/10 DOWN days caught, 20/21 UP days caught

previous_feedback.critical_problem: Model predicts ALL 2959 samples as DOWN (100%). P(DOWN) range [0.517, 0.559] with std=0.007. This is a degenerate trivial predictor with ZERO classification skill.

root_causes.primary: Optuna objective function exploit: composite (40% F1_DOWN + 30% AUC + 30% balanced_acc) has trivial floor of 0.562 for all-DOWN. Optuna best=0.567, barely above trivial.
root_causes.secondary: Extreme over-regularization: learning_rate=0.003, reg_lambda=6.28, reg_alpha=1.38, n_estimators=100. Effective learning=0.3 steps.
root_causes.tertiary: scale_pos_weight=0.81 down-weights UP class, amplifying all-DOWN incentive.
root_causes.quaternary: Early stopping on logloss allows convergence to constant output.

mandatory_changes_for_attempt_2.change: Replace Optuna objective with Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC). MCC=0 for ANY trivial predictor. Formula: (TP*TN - FP*FN) / sqrt((TP+FP)(TP+FN)(TN+FP)(TN+FN)). Add trivial-prediction guard: if minority_pct < 15% or pred_std < 0.03, return -1.0.
Relax HP bounds: learning_rate [0.01, 0.15], n_estimators [200, 800], reg_lambda [0.1, 3.0], reg_alpha [0.0, 1.0], min_child_weight [3, 15].
Fix scale_pos_weight to [0.9, 2.0] or class ratio. Change early stopping metric from logloss to auc.
Drop rate_surprise (unsigned). Keep rate_surprise_signed which subsumes it.

anti_patterns: DO NOT use F1_DOWN in Optuna objective (exploitable by all-DOWN prediction)
DO NOT allow reg_lambda > 3.0 or reg_alpha > 1.0
DO NOT use logloss for early stopping (use auc instead)
what_might_still_work: The 18 features have NOT been properly tested -- model was prevented from learning by the objective exploit + over-regularization
Train AUC=0.80 proves features contain in-sample information
Test AUC=0.55 suggests weak but non-zero out-of-sample signal
Feature importance is well-distributed (no single feature dominance)
MCC-based objective + relaxed regularization should produce non-trivial predictions
